pr_title: Adds Nullable and Nonnull annotations to GenericRecord

replies.bodyText: Interesting. I have added javax.annotation.Nonnull to GenericRecord and then IDE put the annotations to subclasses automatically. It seems I should not trust the IDE. Correcting right away.
replies.author: sancar

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to duplicate these annotations in implementations? They're already present in the interface.
timeline.author: puzpuzpuz

replies.bodyText: IDE gives a warning if you don't. I think it is good to see it also here.
replies.author: sancar

replies.bodyText: I see. Thanks for the clarification.
replies.author: puzpuzpuz

timeline.bodyText: still missing here in return type
timeline.author: cangencer
cangencer

replies.bodyText: I just didn't want to add NonNullable for obvious chaining pattern.
replies.author: sancar

timeline.bodyText: I don't see any method named createGenericRecordBuilder ? I think it's newBuilder?
timeline.author: cangencer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,183 +71,215 @@
      *
      * @return an empty generic record builder with same class definition as this one
      */
+    @Nonnull
     Builder newBuilder();
 
     /**
      * Returned {@link Builder} can be used to have exact copy and also just to update a couple of fields. By default,
      * it will copy all the fields.
+     * So instead of following where only the `id` field is updated,
+     * <pre>
+     *     GenericRecord modifiedGenericRecord = genericRecord.createGenericRecordBuilder()

timeline.bodyText: I would shorthand this method to just builder()
timeline.author: cangencer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,183 +71,215 @@
      *
      * @return an empty generic record builder with same class definition as this one
      */
+    @Nonnull
     Builder newBuilder();

timeline.author: cangencer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,183 +71,215 @@ * * @return an empty generic record builder with same class definition as this one */ + @Nonnull Builder newBuilder(); /** * Returned {@link Builder} can be used to have exact copy and also just to update a couple of fields. By default, * it will copy all the fields. + * So instead of following where only the `id` field is updated, + * 
+     *     GenericRecord modifiedGenericRecord = genericRecord.createGenericRecordBuilder()
+     *                         .writeUTF("name", genericRecord.readUTF("name"))
+     *                         .writeLong("id", 4)
+     *                         .writeUTF("surname", genericRecord.readUTF("surname"))
+     *                         .writeInt("age", genericRecord.readInt("age")).build();
+     *
+ * `cloneWithBuilder` used as follows: + * 
+     *     GenericRecord modifiedGenericRecord = genericRecord.cloneWithBuilder().writeInt("id", 4).build();
+     *
* * @return a generic record builder with same class definition as this one and populated with same values. */ + @Nonnull Builder cloneWithBuilder();

timeline.bodyText: put instead of write , as write implies you have to do it sequentially.
timeline.author: cangencer

timeline.bodyText: get instead of read, as read implies sequential access rather than random access
timeline.author: cangencer

timeline.message: Adds Nullable and Nonnull annotations to GenericRecord
add more nonnull annotations and javadoc to getFieldType
